New Records: Fernando Tatis Jr. became the first visiting player to hit multiple Statcast-tracked home runs of at least 445 feet at Dodger Stadium.
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a 448-foot home run off Jack Flaherty in the fifth inning.
Shohei Ohtani's single off Adrian Morejon in the sixth inning proved decisive.
Donovan Solano struck out to end the game with a potential tying run on base.
Pre-Game Insights: Padres manager Mike Shildt emphasized the importance of winning each game to keep their division title hopes alive.
The Padres have already secured a postseason spot but are aiming for the division title.
Post-Match Reflections: Fernando Tatis Jr. expressed determination to keep fighting for the division title.
Padres manager Mike Shildt reflected on the team's journey and expressed confidence in their ability to bounce back.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres made baseball history by clinching their postseason spot with a triple play the night before.
The Padres' loss to the Dodgers put a serious dent in their chances to capture their first division title in 18 years.
